meanings.sent1: The workers were cementing the bricks together to build a strong wall.
meanings.sent2: She is cementing her friendship with her new neighbor by helping with gardening.
meanings.sent3: The siblings were cementing their bond by sharing their toys and playing together.
meanings.sent4: His promise to always be there for her was like cementing their relationship in stone.
meanings.sent5: The handshake was a way of cementing their agreement.

meanings.definition: To make stronger or more solid
meanings.sent1: The additional support beams are cementing the structure of the house.
meanings.sent2: Studying regularly will cement your understanding of the subject.
meanings.sent3: The chef's secret ingredient was cementing his reputation as the best in town.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was like cementing her resolve to achieve her goals.
meanings.sent5: The positive feedback from her boss was cementing her confidence in her abilities.

meanings.definition: The act of making something firm or solid by joining or uniting
meanings.sent1: The cementing of the pieces created a beautiful mosaic.
meanings.sent2: The cementing of the alliance between the two countries was a historic moment.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected teamwork was like a cementing of forces against a common enemy.
meanings.sent4: The artist saw the collaboration as a cementing of creativity and innovation.
meanings.sent5: The ceremony symbolized the cementing of their commitment to each other.
